p: A special property of non-ionic surfactants is cloudpoint, the temperature above which the surfactant phase separates and precipitates out of solution. The cloudpoint should be higher than 37 °C in the ideal case because of the risk of irreversible phase separation in the body [ 39]. The cloudpoint for BSNEDDS was 71–73 °C, providing stabile nanoemulsion in vivo at physiological temperatures.
